text: Excellent ellipsis placement. (E.E.P.)

text: Ladies and gentlemen: the world's worst ever logo

name: zem
text: you must be talking about this

name: steerpike66
text: That was FUNNY. I laughed.

name: steerpike66
text: The Compter: when you need that thread-worm removed from your urethra today. Call now.

name: evolume
text: no, Google's.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Fuck you forever Google has a GREAT logo I'm not angry I'm just disappointed.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Phillipe has to think for a moment because he forgot the word for "logo".

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: panel 4 is the perfect explanation to marketing.

name: mustakrakesh
text: Ray is the Alex P. Keaton of the logo business.

name: geysershitdick
text: A comment left by geysershitdick was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by relaxing, cailetshadow, aperson)

name: rotating-dog
text: Why is this not rated higher?

name: achewoodno1fan
text: A comment left by achewoodno1fan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by rowboat, jezebel, cailetshadow, miaou, slalvation)

name: zem
text: thakns achewoodno1fan. I may be in the minority here but i always enjoy and appreciate your comments. thank you. thanks.

name: gompo
text: I love Ray's super-interested expression in the last panel, like he's taking careful notes on their incredibly astute feedback.

name: hyetal
text: Philippe doesn't seem to be holding it correctly.  I suspect he's just saying what Ray wants to hear, because he is a rad friend.

name: heyman
text:
Well Teodor, I don't know if I like it until the focus group tells me, now do I?
pure gold.

name: tekende
text: This is how many US Presidents operate.

name: nagsworth
text: Todd's logo has a cock and balls protruding from either side.

name: heccibiggs
text: Shit, I literally didn't notice that until I read this.

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Damn. Yes.

Clearly those are something other than wings.

name: stuart
text: wings/wangs

name: fineoakstructure
text: WING WONG

name: rykan
text: Thank god I'm not the only one who noticed!!

name: mindbnder
text: most important question to ask when starting a small business, "can he pay".  Second most important, "casual fridays??"

name: iidebaser
text: I just noticed that ray's shirt is tucked into his thong.

name: donnatron
text: Ray's shirt is ALWAYS tucked into his thong. It's classic!

name: saulbellow
text:
I'd like to take an informal poll as to how people read Philippe's line in the last panel. However, I can't really even describe the variations I've thought of without making a recording, which I refuse to do.

So if you are lurking around in the old assets, why don't you make a recording of your version and link it here? It would solve most of my problems. I don't want to beg, but I will.

Please indicate within seven (7) calendar days if you intend to comply with my demand.

Thank you.

name: pogo
text: Man, nobody but a few fools is ever trolling these back waters, lessen they knows about COMMENTS and are lucky to spot something good. Philippe hesitates because he has just learned the word "logo," and would be saying "it is a perfect" anything, because he is just so agreeable and happy to help.  BTW, have you heard his song by Freezepop?

name: saulbellow
text:
It's more the inflection I'm thinking about, and like I said I can't really describe the inflection very well in words. But here goes:

1: It is a PERfect ... logo!

2: It is a perfect ... logo!

3: It is a perfect ... LOGO!

Actually I'm really just between one and two.

name: pogo
text: It's really GREAT to be debating inflections with Saul Bellow!  I should change into Carl Sandberg.  Anyway, I used to write and produce radio commercials and was often deaf to these nuances, as I seem to remain.  So put the accent where you will, it doesn't seem to change this particualr sentence for me, more's the pity.

name: tekende
text: If you are deaf to such nuances, I would think that would seriously hinder a career in radio commercials, wouldn't it?

name: saulbellow
text: That's what I thought ... five months ago ...

name: pogo
text: Time is relative. Nuances are forever.

name: aelindil
text: Radio commercials are basically just yellin'.  Not much nuance or subtlety involved.

name: courtland
text: All you need is Philippe's opinion really.

name: tekende
text: Ray's stance and expression in the last panel imply to me that Ray has decided to ignore Beef's negative criticism and instead focus on Philippe's praise.

name: random_shorts
text:
No one has yet pointed out the hilarity of Beef's comment.

The fact that the size of a logo would be relative to where and how it was used, somehow, to Beef, is lost. It seems small... for a logo.
